name: agent_proficiency_scale
description: Map a float input (0.0 - 1.0) to ordered agent proficiency levels using nonlinear thresholds. Order (low -> high): Unskilled, Novice, Competent, Proficient, Experienced, Expert.

input.notes: Input represents a normalized proficiency score from 0 (worst) to 1 (best).

thresholds.note: Nonlinear thresholds chosen so visual order and spacing are clear; thresholds are inclusive on the lower bound. Format: level: [min, max)

mapping_function.description: Map input float to the first level whose [min,max) interval contains the input. Intervals are nonlinear (wider in the middle to reflect diminishing returns near extremes).

u32_mapping.description: Map input float [0.0,1.0] to the unsigned 32-bit integer range [0, 4294967295] and assign contiguous subranges to each proficiency level. This is just for human eyes.
u32_mapping.mapping_algorithm: u32 = floor(input_float * 4294967295); find level whose u32 range contains u32; if input_float == 1.0 map to highest u32 (4294967295) and therefore 'Expert'.

visual_hint: Levels are ordered low->high in the 'levels' array and the thresholds increase monotonically; spacing is nonlinear to make mid-levels more granular.
